Sure, here are some examples of taste profile clashes:

* Sweet and sour: Mixing very sweet and very sour ingredients can create an unbalanced or unpleasant taste experience. For example, a salad dressing made with too much vinegar and not enough sugar may be too sour for some people.
* Salty and bitter: Combining very salty and very bitter flavors can create an unpleasant taste experience. For example, a dish that is over-salted and has bitter greens like kale may be too intense for some people.
* Sweet and savory: In some cases, combining very sweet and very savory flavors can be overwhelming. For example, a dish that has a lot of sugar added to a meat-based sauce may be too sweet for some people.
